data.title: Kamal Haasan shares updates on 'Indian 2', 'Thug Life' and 'Kalki 2898 AD'
data.meta_description: Kamal Haasan, in a recent interaction, shared updates about director Shankar's 'Indian 2' and 'Indian 3'. He also spoke about when he would resume the shooting of Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life'.
data.text:
Ulaganayagan Kamal Haasan shared an update about his upcoming films, 'Indian 2', 'Thug Life' and 'Kalki 2898 AD'. In a recent interaction with The Hindu, the 'Vikram' actor opened up about the status of these three projects and when they would release. Going by his update, director Shankar's 'Indian 2' will be his upcoming release, which is currently in the post-production phase. It has been over a year since Kamal Haasan appeared on the big screen and his fans have been waiting with bated breath to see him back on screen.

advertisement

In 2022, he starred in director Lokesh Kanagaraj's 'Vikram', which became one of his best films in his career. After 'Vikram', he has been shooting for director Shankar's 'Indian 2'. In a recent interview, he shared the status of his upcoming films.

Speaking to the publication recently, he said, "I can't make up for the lost time. Also, we cannot speed up production as the quantity doesn't matter, quality does. We have completed 'Indian 2' and 'Indian 3'. The post-production work of 'Indian 2' is currently happening. We will start work on 'Indian 3' post-production after we finish it."

He continued, "The shooting of Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' will start soon after the campaign [election] ends. Also, I've done a cameo in a film called 'Kalki 2898 AD'."

Kamal Haasan is currently on a break from work as he is all set to campaign for the ruling party, Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK), in the upcoming Lok Sabha election. After he wraps up his political commitments, he will resume work on the film front.
